title: Car takes off and ends up in a petrol station in horrendous crash
text:
A car flew through the air and landed in a petrol station after its driver lost control.

CCTV footage taken in Narmada, Gujarat in India, captured the shocking accident.

Two men, two women and a ten-year-old girl were inside the car and were all injured.

CCTV footage from a petrol station in Narmada, Gujarat in India, shows a car flying through the air before landing in a petrol station

One man and woman were severely injured and the whole family is still being treated in hospital.

The clip shows the car heading down the road at speed as another vehicle attempts to turn.

The car tries to avoid the oncoming vehicle by swerving into the petrol station.

It then mounts what appears to be a road divider placed by the entrance and is catapulted into the air.

The car tries to avoid an oncoming vehicle by swerving into the petrol station. After mounting what appears to be a road divider placed by the entrance it is catapulted into the air before landing on one side and flipping over

It soars for a few seconds before landing on its left side and rolling over onto the roof.

Astounded onlookers watch the accident unfold before sprinting over to help the injured as a cloud of dust is left behind.

The family, from Maharashtra in west India, were on the way to see the Statue of Unity when the accident happened.
description: CCTV footage taken in Narmada, Gujarat in India, captured the shocking accident that injured five. Two men, two women and a girl, ten, were inside the car and were all injured and are still in hospital.
